content:
In practice, is there a difference between these two installation methods for elan:

  • curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/leanprover/elan/master/elan-init.sh -sSf | sh
  • downloading the platform release tarball

Context: Currently, lean-action downloads the elan-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz release tarball to install elan (I believe I copied this pattern from the mathlib CI), however using https://raw.githubusercontent.com/leanprover/elan/master/elan-init.sh would be easier to support and allow lean-action to support more GitHub runners.

Both options seem to work, and both options are listed on the elan installation instructions, so I doubt this will be an issue, but I figured I would still ask.
elan-init.sh isn't that long, you can just read it :)

Sebastian Ullrich said:

elan-init.sh isn't that long, you can just read it :)

Good point. Reading the script answered my question. elan-init.sh downloads the release after determining the platform. Thanks for the nudge.
Austin Letson has marked this topic as resolved.
